channel.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News Today: Read the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Pentagon in turmoil: Trump reportedly plans to fire senior military leaders who prioritized DEI
item.description: Incoming President Donald Trump's transition team is reportedly compiling a list of senior military officers who prioritized diversity initiatives over combat readiness. Sources claim an executive order is being drafted to establish a panel for recommending the removal of these officers.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Missouri teacher charged with offering marijuana for sex with students: 'F***ked up'
item.description: Carissa Jane Smith, a 30-year-old former substitute teacher from Missouri, is facing serious charges including statutory rape, sodomy, and sexual trafficking. Smith is accused of engaging in sexual acts with multiple students in exchange for money, alcohol, and marijuana.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When Pete Hegseth hit a man with an ax on live TV. Video goes viral
item.description: ​Hegseth, an Army National Guard officer, participated in an ax-throwing contest against Clayton Morris on Fox and Friends. Hegseth hitting a man was not intentional but despite his military training, he could not throw the ax on the target and instead hit a drummer standing on the road. Hegseth was later sued over the incident.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel makes fun of RFK Jr: 'Who better than guy whose brain eaten by worm'
item.description: “This tells you all you need to know about our country right now: RFK got caught having phone sex with a reporter and she was fired,” Kimmel continued. “What happened to him? They made him secretary of health and human services. Why not? I mean, if Matt Gaetz is going to be attorney general, bring in Gary Busey to run the CIA. Go for broke!” Kimmel said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Democrats think this is Swastika': Row over chest tattoo of Trump's secretary of defense Pete Hegseth
item.description: Pete Hegseth's chest tattoo, a Jerusalem cross, sparked controversy on social media with some calling it Nazi Swastika. The tattoo previously caused Hegseth to be deemed an extremist and barred from guarding President Biden's inauguration. “And my orders were revoked to guard the Biden inauguration. Jerusalem cross tattoo, it’s just a Christian symbol ... [that] is what got me disinvited," Hegseth said earlier.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sylvester Stallone calls Donald Trump 'second George Washington': 'I mean it'
item.description: “And I'll just say this, and I mean it: When George Washington defended his country, he had no idea that he was going to change the world. ’cause without him, you could imagine what the world would look like. Guess what? We got the second George Washington,” Sylvester Stallone who never identified as a Republican and did not endorse Donald Trump said about Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Typhoon Man-yi nears Philippines as nation struggles to recover from Usagi
item.description: Typhoon Man-yi, packing winds of 150 kph, is set to strike the Philippines' Catanduanes Island late Saturday, triggering mass evacuations. This comes on the heels of Typhoon Usagi, which ravaged the nation just days ago, leaving a trail of destruction and stranded communities in northern Luzon.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Fire breaks out at Spanish retirement home, at least 10 killed
item.description: A fire ripped through "Jardines de Villafranca," a retirement home in northern Spain, early Friday morning, resulting in the tragic loss of at least 10 lives. The blaze, which ignited around 5 am local time, took firefighters approximately two hours to contain.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sri Lanka election results: President Dissanayake’s NPP claims landslide victory
item.description: Sri Lanka's National People's Power (NPP) party, led by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, secured a majority in the parliamentary snap elections on Friday. The NPP won 107 seats with nearly 62% of the vote, exceeding the required majority.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Mysterious orbs and triangles: Pentagon's new report on UFO cases leave experts baffled
item.description: The Pentagon and intelligence officials released their yearly report on UFO sightings, now called UAPs. They investigated over 750 new reports but found no proof of alien life. However, 21 cases remain unexplained, often involving strange shapes like orbs and triangles seen near military areas. While some could be drones, experts are baffled and continue to investigate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: NZ's youngest MP stirs Parliament with haka call, tears up controversial bill
item.description: New Zealand's parliament witnessed dramatic scenes as a controversial bill proposing to redefine the country's founding treaty between Māori and the British Crown passed its first vote. The bill, facing widespread opposition and protests, aims to apply the treaty's principles to all New Zealanders, a move critics argue could fuel racial tensions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iran to open 'hijab removal treatment clinic' for women who oppose mandates
item.description: Iran's announcement of a 'treatment facility' for women who violate hijab laws has drawn international condemnation. The facility, intended to provide 'scientific and psychological treatment,' is seen by many as a prison and an escalation of the government's crackdown on women's rights, sparking fear and anger among Iranian women.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: One dead, thousands without heating after Russian strike on Ukraine port city
item.description: A Russian attack on the Ukrainian port city of Odesa has left one person dead and 10 others injured. The strikes, which took place overnight, caused damage to residential buildings, churches, and educational institutions. The attack also damaged the main heating pipeline, leaving tens of thousands of residents without heat as temperatures drop.

item.title: China battles rare wave of violent crime as economic woes bite
item.description: China's economic malaise is fuelling social tensions that make people more likely to commit violent crimes out of anger or desperation, analysts say, after the country witnessed its deadliest massacre in a decade. It followed a string of similar crimes as China struggles to revive economic growth, keep people employed and boost confidence since it ended rigid Covid curbs in late 2022.

item.title: How much Trump would pay Musk & Ramaswamy to lead DOGE? Zilch!
item.description: Elon Musk defended the efficiency of the new Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), stating that neither he nor Vivek Ramaswamy are being paid for their leadership roles. Musk highlighted DOGE's mission to streamline government operations and reduce waste, emphasizing its potential to benefit the American people.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: North Korea's Kim Jong-un orders 'mass production' of suicide attack drones
item.description: Kim Jong Un, the leader of North Korea, has ordered the mass production of suicide attack drones following a successful test. These drones, designed to strike land and sea targets, are intended to bolster North Korea's military capabilities and are being manufactured at a rapid pace.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China's president unveils a megaport in Peru, but locals say they're being left out
Investigators assess if Netanyahu’s aides forged Oct 7 phone records
item.description: Following a major security failure that allowed Hamas to launch a surprise attack on Israel last year, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office is embroiled in scandal. Aides to the PM are accused of tampering with official records, including details about a crucial phone call with a top general who warned of the impending invasion.

item.title: Sri Lanka election results: President Dissanayake's NPP headed for landslide victory
item.description: Sri Lanka's National People's Power (NPP) party, led by President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, is poised to win a majority in the recent parliamentary elections. With over 62% of the vote, the NPP has secured 52 seats so far, significantly outperforming opposition parties. The victory positions Dissanayake to implement his socialist agenda and address the country's economic crisis.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Remove words ‘secularism’ & ‘socialism’ from Bangladesh statute: AG
item.description: Bangladesh's Attorney General, Md Asaduzzaman, sparked controversy by advocating for the removal of "socialism" and "secularism" from the constitution. He argued that these principles contradict the nation's predominantly Muslim identity. Asaduzzaman's proposal, made during a hearing on the validity of the 15th amendment, ignited debate about the country's future direction and drew criticism from legal experts.
